intro: Trichotosia brachybotrya, commonly known as the short-stalked trichotosia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant features slender, hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its small, daisy-like flowers typically bloom in shades of white and yellow, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Trichotosia brachybotrya is considered a species of conservation concern.
